user.rawDescription: A nonprofit of gay people and others within the community against the sexualization, indoctrination and medicalization of children under the guise of "LGBTQIA+"

rawContent:
Read our full statement that was sent:

We are Gays Against Groomers. We have officially submitted this statement to be read on our behalf: 

Gays Against Groomers is a 501(c)4 organization of gay people who oppose the recent trend of indoctrinating, sexualizing and medicalizing children under the guise of “LGBTQIA+” 
 
We are disgusted that NJ state Attorney General filed a motion to stop a local school board from protecting parental rights. Every parent has the right to know what’s going on with their children, and a majority of parents today are far more accepting, compassionate and understanding than our government is currently giving them credit for.  
 
The Attorney General’s argument was that parents wanting to know if their child is going through an identity crisis is somehow a violation of New Jersey’s Law Against Discrimination, so we decided to look into what’s supposedly the “most comprehensive anti-discrimination law in the country.” What we found is a loophole under the Protected Classes Under the LAD, which states that The LAD prohibits discrimination and bias-based harassment based on actual or perceived and then a long list of reasons people can say they’re discriminated against but let’s go back to that word: perceived.   
 
There are two definitions, one of them is ‘become aware of’ and the other is ‘interpret’ or ‘regard as.’ For those of you who don’t understand what this means, it’s a weaponization of language to give your children the power to claim they’re being discriminated against at home even if they’re not. It’s all based on their interpretation. If they feel it, it must be true. We never thought we would see the day when our government would enable this kind of overreach, split up our families and take ownership of our children. And we never thought we’d see other parents supporting it.   
 
Language is so important. It determines how we see ourselves and each other, it sets boundaries and describes our feelings. But it also enables deception, allows loopholes, and can convince the ignorant that they want oppression as long as it sounds like a good thing. In this case, language is being used against parents to destroy their rights. Their children would not exist without them. 
 
Who are you to tell these parents how to love their children? Who are you to take them away from their parents because of “perceived” discrimination? Most parents won’t let their kids eat ice cream all day, does that make them an oppressor? Is that discrimination? Because that is how ridiculous all of this sounds.  
 
Parents are meant to know what is best for their children, and that doesn’t mean giving them what they want all the time. If you want parents to be more accepting, don’t get in between them and their children. Help them, educate them, respect them but don't take their rights away. Because that will be the real problem, especially for those of you hoping to get reelected.
